title: Calibration Campaign
outcome: A citywide calibration campaign is launched by the Council using Halden’s old system prompts, subtly nudging each community to return to prior BCI-aligned routines. At first, some neighborhoods see restored access and smoother services. But hidden messages referencing Halden’s original codes sow suspicion. Residents debate whether to comply or resist, with old pilot districts fracturing into rival camps. The Council touts improvement, but fear of covert manipulation—echoing early BCI pilot warnings—spreads, reigniting rumors Halden left secret traps in the system.

events.description: Council launches a 'Citywide Calibration' initiative, recommending daily routines and behaviors, using benign prompts linked to BCI services returned in pilot districts.
Eagle-eyed residents notice embedded codes in prompts that reference notorious Halden updates. Conspiracy theories circulate warning of hidden control mechanisms.
The Directorate praises positive feedback loops and improved service metrics, but Innovators worry the initiative is reviving old BCI compliance regimes.
Old BCI pilot zones split, with some communities opting for full recalibration and others sabotaging prompts. Accusations of 'traitors' and 'Council puppets' escalate quarreling.
Visible calm returns in some districts, but anxiety over covert manipulation runs high. Secret gatherings form to decipher or obstruct the Council’s methods.
